title: RedHawks ranked 18th in USCHO.com poll
text:
RedHawks ranked 18th in USCHO.com poll 
Updated: Mon, Oct 12 2015, 03:43 PM 
OXFORD, Ohio (WKRC) -- A hard fought tie against the defending national champions last Saturday has the Miami hockey team still sitting in the national rankings this week. The RedHawks are ranked 18th in this weekâ€™s USCHO.com poll and are receiving votes in the USA Today/USA Hockey Magazine poll after going 0-1-1 against Providence, who moved to No. 2 in both polls, last weekend. Fellow National Collegiate Hockey Conference foe North Dakota is the new No. 1 team in both polls. Other NCHC teams that are ranked in at least one poll include Omaha (No. 3/4), Denver (No. 5/8), Minnesota Duluth (No. 7/7) and St. Cloud State (No. 12/12). Miami plays a home-and-home against in-state rival Ohio State starting with a Friday tilt in Columbus at 7 p.m. Image and information courtesy Miami Univ Athletics Related Stories
